newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end lower after sharp initial gains.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end lower after sharp initial gains.

text.p: Madrid stocks ended lower on Tuesday, overturning initial sharp gains on technical factors, dealers said.
Stocks are seen consolidating, and then moving higher again.
The general index fell 1.55 points, 0.32 percent, to 488.05 and the Ibex shed 17.64 points, 0.31 percent, to 5,603.10.

The market's focus should now shift to Thursday's release of February CPI data, with a possible key rate cut seen on Friday. But volatility ahead of those figures may keep investors wary, dealers said.
Trade today was characterised by heavy volume, backed by domestic funds, and concentrated in Telefonica, Santander and Endesa. But most were optimistic.
"The market got weaker during the afternoon, but it's got a very firm base which may allow for new gains short term, and clearly in the medium term" said one dealer.
February inflation, is seen on average at 2.9 percent year-on-year, in which case some see room for a fresh Bank of Spain rate cut on Friday.
However others argue that the peseta's current performance will hold the central bank off.
